0 31-Jan-2017 03:05:00 Goal summarises the biggest transfer talk from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, the Bundesliga and beyond BARCELONA SNAP UP BUENO 
Barcelona have agreed a deal to sign Uruguay Under-20 international defender Santiago Bueno, according to gianlucadimarzio.com . 
The 18-year-old centre-back (pictured right) is currently playing for Penarol in his home country. CSL BID FOR RONDON REJECTED 
West Brom have rejected a £32 million bid from Tianjin Quanjian for star striker Salomon Rondon, according to the Daily Mail . 
The Chinese Super League club was previously credited with an interest in Diego Costa but have been told Rondon is not for sale at any price. LEICESTER TO SIGN WAGUE 
Leicester City have tied up a deal to sign Udinese defender Molla Wague, according to gianlucadimarzio.com . 
The Mali international, who represented his country at the Africa Cup of Nations, will join the Premier League champions on loan with an option to buy. WEST BROM MAKE RODRIGUEZ BID 
West Brom have made a £10 million offer for Southampton forward Jay Rodriguez, according to the Guardian . 
With Southampton set to sign Manolo Gabbiadini from Napoli, the Baggies have turned their attention to Rodriguez having failed to land Hull City striker Abel Hernandez. PALACE AGREE MILIVOJEVIC DEAL 
Crystal Palace have agreed a deal to sign Olympiacos midfielder Luka Milivojevic for £12.5 million, according to Sky Sports . 
The 25-year-old Serbia international will fly in to London to complete a medical and make the deal official on Tuesday. GABBIADINI'S SAINTS MOVE AGREED 
Southampton have agreed a deal to sign forward Manolo Gabbiadini from Napoli, according to Sky Sport Italia . 
The Saints will pay €17 million up front for the Italian, with a further €3m payable depending on certain performance-related targets. IVANOVIC SET FOR ZENIT 
Chelsea's Branislav Ivanovic is set to complete a move to Zenit St. Petersburg within the next 24 hours, Sky Sports report s . 
The Serbian defender, who has failed to impress Antonio Conte since the Italian's arrival at Stamford Bridge, has only personal terms left to agree before the switch is finalised. GIBSON & OVIEDO TO SUNDERLAND 
Everton duo Darron Gibson and Bryan Oviedo are undergoing medicals ahead of joining Sunderland, according to Sky Sports . 
Ex-Manchester United man Gibson and Oviedo, who both played under Moyes at Goodison Park, are set to be reunited with their former manager at the Stadium of Light after becoming surplus to requirements on Merseyside. BENZEMA OFFERED TO ARSENAL 
Real Madrid have offered France forward Karim Benzema to both Arsenal and Chelsea, according to Diario Gol . 
Madrid president Florentino Perez is reportedly frustrated with the 29-year-old, especially after fans booed the striker following their La Liga clash with Real Sociedad. Perez has informed both Premier League sides that he is willing to sell, while PSG are also in the hunt for the former Lyon man. LEICESTER WANT RAMIREZ AND MBODJI 
Leicester City are keen to add two new faces to their squad ahead of the transfer deadline as the club weighs up moves for Gaston Ramirez and Kara Mbodji, the Leicester Mercury reports . 
According to the newspaper, Leicester have already had bids rejected by Middlesbrough and Anderlecht respectively, but the Premier League champions have not given up on their targets. ARSENAL IN TALKS WITH ALLEGRI 
Arsenal are in talks with the representatives of Juventus coach Max Allegri, according to the Sunday Express . 
Arsene Wenger is yet to sign a new contract at the Emirates Stadium and the Italian could be in line to replace him at the end of the season. CHELSEA RETURN FOR GORDON 
Celtic are considering an increased £3.5 million bid made by Chelsea for goalkeeper Craig Gordon, according to the Daily Mail . 
The Blues had an opening £2.5m offer rejected but remain in the hunt for a new signing as Asmir Begovic is likely to leave the club before the transfer deadline. EVERTON REJECT MCCARTHY BID 
Everton have rejected a £16 million bid from Newcastle United for Irish midfielder James McCarthy, according to a report in the Daily Mail . 
The 26-year-old Republic of Ireland international, who has made just six Premier League starts this season, is a target for boss Rafa Benitez as he looks to steer the Magpies back into the top division, but Everton are reluctant to sell. AUBAMEYANG TO REPLACE STURRIDGE 
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp wants to raid former club Borussia Dortmund for star striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as a replacement for Daniel Sturridge, according to the Sunday Mirror . 
The Gabon international, who's valued at around £70 million by Dortmund, is on a transfer shortlist that also includes Athletic forward Inaki Williams. LIVERPOOL RACE TO SIGN PAREDES 
Liverpool have been alerted to Leandro Paredes' availability and will offer Roma €26.5 million for his signature, writes The Sun . 
The Argentine playmaker is surplus to requirements in the Italian capital with the club keen to sell him and raise funds to bring in Atalanta talent Franck Kessie. 
And Liverpool are ready to tempt their Serie A counterparts into a sale with an initial €22.5m bid plus €4m in bonuses as they attempt to arrest their slump. ROMA BEAT CHELSEA TO KESSIE 
Roma have completed negotiations to sign Atalanta starlet Franck Kessie this summer, reports Corriere dello Sport . 
The man widely tipped as the next Yaya Toure following his breakthrough season in Serie A had seen him come to the attention of Europe's elite, including Chelsea and Paris Saint-Germain, but Roma appear to have beaten them with a €30 million offer plus two youth team players in part exchange. ARSENAL TRY TO HIJACK GRIEZMANN BID 
Arsenal are ready to challenge Manchester United to the signing of Antoine Griezmann, according to The Mail on Sunday . 
United are said to be leading the race to sign the £85 million rated striker who was voted the third best in the world over the last year. Having made an initial approach to sign the France international in the summer, Arsenal are reportedly ready to match his release clause, though the Red Devils are expected to have the upper hand when it comes to wages. ATLETICO OFFER ALEXIS EXIT 
Atletico Madrid are ready to offer Alexis Sanchez a route out of Arsenal as they line up a replacement for Antoine Griezmann, according to the Sun . 
The Spaniards are prepared to hand the Chilean a deal worth £220,000 a week, significantly more than the £160,000 weekly on the table from the Gunners. TOTTENHAM WANT £25M ZAHA 
Tottenham are considering a late £25 million bid for Crystal Palace winger Wilfried Zaha, according to the Sun . 
The Ivory Coast international is a long-term target of Mauricio Pochettino's but Crystal Palace are determined not to sell as they fight relegation. MAN UTD CLEAR ROONEY FOR CHINA MOVE 
Manchester United are prepared to let Wayne Rooney move to China in a deal that will see him become the highest paid player in the world, Sunday Mirror reports. 
Several Chinese Super League sides have shown they are prepared to offer Rooney an incredible £140 million deal, and Jose Mourinho has given it the nod. LEICESTER REJECT £38M SLIMANI BID 
Leicester City have turned down a £38 million bid for Algeria international Islam Slimani, according to Sky Sports . 
Chinese Super League club Tianjin Quanjian made an offer for Slimani, but the Foxes are unwilling to sell the striker after only signing him in August. Tianjin were willing to pay the 28-year-old £300,000 a week to move to China. Related
